dialogues.text: And me, him. Role playing. Trauma. Hands grips hair. Nails dig into flesh. Skin is almost pierced with teeth. pleasure and pain. Tim cries silently through it. over and over, barely audible. Lips meet in Says this  83 84 61.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: I want to see them, let me see them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rises over the ocean. Randi and her friends get into car and back out of the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front window of the house. We see Richard’s drawn fac staring out with sad bloodshot eyes

dialogues.speaker: DAY 4
dialogues.text: INT. HOUSE - JONATHAN’S ROOM - DAWN 84 Jonathan’s eyes reflect the wear and tear. He finishes dialing his cell, drops it, fumbles for it, picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Jane?

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea what time it is, Jonathan?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: It’s...

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: -five thirty in the morning. Miles is sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I just miss him and-

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: -you know Daniel works late. Daniel stirs next to her in bed.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Oh right, so he can control the world’s oil markets. How do those guys make so much money when the whole the country is broke? Jonathan winces, knows he shouldn’t have said that.  85 62.

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Are you drunk?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Course not. I’m high.

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: My God Jonathan. You get together with your old friends and you can’t even pretend to be grown-ups.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I’m pretending you still love me.

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: I'm hanging up.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Tell me Jane, how did it go from you loving me to not loving me. Tell me again. Tell me Jane. (she hangs up) I want to hear it again. Jonathan looks at his cell phone, lets it drop to the flo He picks a random prescription bottle from the many on hi bedside table, opens it, takes a pill out and dry swallow it. He glances at the label afterward: Ketamine. JONATHAN (CONT’D) Good choice, doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard enters the living room and sees Tim standing ther walking down the hallway with a vacuum cleaner. Stands th still.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: I’m going to go on a cleaning frenzy. He turns it on and begins to vacuum. Richard watches Tim clean. The house is a wreck. Tim is oblivious to him and zombie focused on the task.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I’m gonna follow Ron and Jonathan's lead and crash. Tim smiles the most beautiful smile at Richard.  86 87 88 63.

dialogues.speaker: TIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s going to look completely different in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immaculate. Like the party never happened. Quiet. Only distant surf through the glass. Tim walks quietly through the spotless kitchen, cracks op windows throughout the house to let in fresh air. He walks down the hallway to Richard’s room. Richard is passed out on the bed. Tim stares, sees Richard’s jacket crumpled on the floor, moves to it, hangs it neatly acros the back of a chair. He stares at Richard’s face. He walks out into the hallway, quietly closes Richard’s d behind him. He walks into his room. He zips open his bag, reaches int it, pulls out a rolled up piece of paper. Opens it and re it. We see fragments of writing on it and remember it from hi bed at the beginning. Tim turns, catches his reflection in a bureau mirror. He stares, expression even.

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO BLACK
dialogues.text: INT. HOUSE - JONATHAN’S ROOM - TWO HOURS LATER - LATE 87

dialogues.speaker: MORNING
dialogues.text: Close on Jonathan’s face, on his closed eyes. We hear a strange distant sonic hiss. It sounds otherworldly, Ketamine altered, like time itsel making sounds. He opens his eyes, listens. Pipes, maybe. Or a shower. He can hear it now. He listens a beat, then covers his he with a pillow, falls back into a Ketamine slumber. JONATHAN’S ROOM - ONE HOUR LATER 88 Jonathan wakes again to the same sound. He listens a mome  89 90 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan walks out of his room, loses his balance, uses t wall to steady himself. He arrives at the bathroom door. Listens. He turns the handle. It’s open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he walks inside. He cannot see for the thick steam.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Hello? There’s no answer. Steam pours out. Jonathan can’t be sur but something is coming into view inside the shower. Something hovering inside of it. Jonathan stops cold. Stares. HE SUDDENLY LUNGES FORWARD A THROWS THE SLIDING GLASS SHOWER DOOR OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: TIM.
dialogues.text: Hanging from a rope that’s tied to a pipe that juts out f the wall in the shower. Jonathan tries to lift him, to take the pressure off his neck, to get him down, to get him safe. The hot water burns down on him, he SCREAMS through the anguish and hot water and Ketamine... JONATHAN (CONT ’D) Rich! Rich! Fucking help me! Jonathan loses his balance in the water, falls against th shower door, pops it off it’s rails. It crashes against t toilet and THE GLASS SHATTERS.

dialogues.speaker: SECONDS LATER
dialogues.text: Richard bursts in, freezes, dives toward the water faucet winds them off, grabs Tim by the legs, raises him. Jonathan lifts the rope off the pipe, walks on the broken glass, helps Richard lay Tim on the floor.  91 65. Jonathan kneels next to him, begins to administer CPR, ha we hear Tim’s sternum crack...after twenty seconds he doe something strange: he sits back, slides against a wall, a just stares.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing!? Jonathan looks at Richard.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: He’s dead. Seconds pass. The faucet drips. Life goes on elsewhere in the world, and the world revolves around the sun. Ron appears in the doorway. Looks at them. The rope aroun Tim’s neck. SEES IT ALL. Ron is speechless. Richard sees something laying across the sink. A rolled u sheet of paper. He stands, moves to it. Jonathan climbs to his feet as Ron steps inside. Richard does something as the paper comes into view: he stops. Like the thought that flashed through his mind was violating it had physical impact. He steps toward the sink, unrolls it. We recognize it fro Tim’s apartment: the paper that was on his bed. Richard reads in silence. Richard laughs. A strange laugh. A laugh laced with confusion. Jonathan and Ron look at each other. Richard leaves it, walks out of the steamy room, a little crazed. WE MOVE WITH HIM DOWN THE HALLWAY AND STAY ON HIS FACE. He stops walking, stares at us. He is utterly stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron paces the room. Jonathan stares out the front window of the house. Richard sits on the couch with the paper laid out on the coffee table, studies it like it’s a part of himself he thought he’d lost forever. Nobody says a word. They are searching for a way in.  66. Richard stares at it. He blurts out something incongruous something that instantly gets Jonathan and Ron’s attentio

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Motherfucker. He beat me to the punch. Ron stops pacing, stares at Richard, disbelieving. Jonathan turns from the window.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Help me here, I’m lost. Richard touches the note with his fingers...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I’m not. I remember everything. Senior year, the room upstairs with the green couch and Joy Division posters all over the walls. Like yesterday. They search to remember. Jonathan sways in stillness near the front window. Ron sits down, dazed, stares at Richard

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Wait, that’s right. It was Timmy’s idea...he said something like ‘are we gonna remember this moment, or have friend’s like this...’ Richard takes over, through the drugs and emotion he remembers like it was yesterday...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: ...’are we ever going to feel like this again, this alive and possible and free again? I’1l never forget that. And yet I did. I fucking forgot it.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: We all did.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Tim didn’t. No we see the PAPER AND NOTE FULL ON. The paper is yellowed and crinkled with age. The words ar in a faded dark marker. EACH LINE WAS WRITTEN BY A DIFFERENT HAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: £6 years from now if WE CAn’t remEMber what this feels like, then we have f moment... who we said we’d become, our PROMISE TO each other, swear will never forget! See THIS/our life.. we want to live and the men we want t To forget this feeling, is to FAIL and if we forget it, t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we will die as one. The names are signed... rich tim JR Ron There is a long silence, a processing. The dead body of their best friend is down the hall. Ron is imploding. He needs a drink. He needs to flee.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Yeah, but we said a lot of things when we’re young. Richard stares at Ron.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: So your word is no good? This means nothing? Ron looks at the note on the table, reads it again, looks back at Richard. The truth of the situation descends on h envelopes him. He begins pacing again.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: We have to call the police. Right? Ron appeals to Jonathan. To say something. Jonathan shrug

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: And say what?...’hello officer. We signed this pact when we were in college and our friend is dead. Can you come pick up the dead body?’ Jonathan moves away from the window, unsteady. He uses th wall for balance.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Who fucking gives a shit?  68.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Timmy obviously did...he remembered what we wanted to be. And so do I. Ron sweats, heart and mind racing. Jonathan grinds his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: This is insane. We’re high, we're fucking high as shit!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Which is exactly why we need to think this through. Ron tries to convince himself this is not happening.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: We’ll come down, sleep. Yeah, sleep it off. We just need it to be the next day. It’1ll be all right. We'll figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I can’t come down. Ron stops pacing, something has just occurred to him. Ron Wait wait wait...I’m confused. Are we talking about not calling the cops? The question hangs in the air. Then we hear two voices, o inside, one out. One thinks it, one says it.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN/RICHARD
dialogues.text: All our names are on the note. Ron looks between them. This line of thinking is not possible. He knows them and this cannot be happening. Richard looks back at the note, touches the words...

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (explodes, LOUD) What that shit fucking scrawl signified means nothing! I am not the fucking same fool who wrote my name on that, AND NEITHER ARE you!!! Things change!! Silence, then...  69.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: You are certainly not the same person Ron.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What the fuck does that mean? Jonathan raises his eyes, lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: So our bond means nothing to you, the promise, all that was for nothing? Your dead friend?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: It means we think about it.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: It means I am not the same person. None of us are. The camera slows... we all slow down. TIME STOPS. We see Richard stare at the note. We see Ron SCREAM (silently). We see Jonathan exhale cigarette smoke. And the VOICE, objective and soothing, curious.

dialogues.speaker: THE VOICE
dialogues.text: Could they pinpoint the exact moment in time they went from who they were, to who they had become? Was it at that moment that their bonds became falsified? And a more burdensome question seem to present itself: it wasn’t whether or not their annual meeting was a sham or a ritual, but whether or not the countless days and nights and minutes and hours that they were apart was the sham and the ritual.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME SCENE
dialogues.text: Jonathan exhales smoke, looks at Ron.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: You are not the same person, the same friend now? Fuck you Ron. Ron backhands a vase off a table and it shatters against wall.  70. He sees a saucer with a pile of coke on it in front of Richard. He grabs it, does a line, drops it on the kitche table. He rubs his face with both hands, turns to them.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I’m a father. I ama fucking father!

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (to Jonathan) So are you. Richard, invective in hand, slams a huge slug of booze.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: It is all the result of measuring little results against high expectations. He sees his son once every two weeks and his son calls his stepfather “dad.” (beat) You write your name in blood and what does it mean? Your blood means hooey. Go home Ron. Go home to your mother, go to your wife who thinks you're a God, explain how badly you disappointed, failed, fucked up. And how bad did you fuck up, Ron? You greedy cocksucker. What did you do? Are you a bank robber? Did you steal people’s money? (Rich cocks and shoots both his forefingers like a gunslinger in the old west) You fucking bank robber! Are you like the hideous men we read about? (to Jonathan) Jonathan, did our little Ronnie go bad on us? Ron stares at them, calmly reaches into his pocket, remov his Blackberry, dials, listens...

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Can I have the number for the local police department? In one swift moment Richard lunges and snatches the phone from Ron’s hand and hangs up.  71.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (utterly calm) Someone. Committed. Suicide. The police must be called, a report must be made.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: So your word is no good? No discussions? Jonathan is holding the note, trembling now. Clearly not altogether, not unusual considering.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: It is who we are, but if when we wrote it, we are not that now...

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: -let me get this straight. I’m supposed to follow through on some twenty-five year old idealistic bullshit I do not remember? Are you serious Richard? This is not how it works, this is not relevant to now. Tim is dead. Richard holds up his hand, gestures with each word.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Exactly. And. You. Signed. It. With glazed eyes of chemical sadness, Jonathan looks at R

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Our brains are wired wrong, our minds are unsound and not thinking correctly. Anything can happen. We are not rational now, Ron. We are whistling in the dark. We are considering options. We return to this very unreal real world. Haywire.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Timmy died for his reasons. Guilt, I know he could never forgive himself. But he did it.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (defensive) He was weak.  72. Richard moves menacingly towards Ron.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (a vicious hiss) It was his life. His choice. You know what? You’ve never followed through on anything. Even then. You know what we called you behind your back? Rat Ron, ‘cause you were a fucking rodent. Selling us tickets to concerts that you got for free. Trying to fuck Jonathan's girlfriend. Rat fucking Ron, always playing THE MAN, the guy with the cash. Tell me RAT RON, is that why you’re in so much trouble?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: You dirty little fucking loser, where’s your best-selling books, huh you fuck? You forget when ‘rat Ron’ got your fucking ass out of jail in senior year because your fucking mommy didn’t have the money? Fucking arty little Richard, always out of money. And I always had it, that was my role. You were art and I was commerce, that’s what you used to say! (to Jonathan) And how much money have I made for you over the years, you fucking zombie quack fuck? Jonathan doesn’t answer. Ron reaches for his Blackberry b Richard jumps up and backs away into the kitchen, scoots behind the kitchen table, uses it as a barrier as Ron follows.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: It’s not only your decision to make. Richard moves around the table. He sees the saucer of blo on the table. He licks his fingertips and dips them in. He stops moving around the table, waits for Ron. When Ron right in front of him Richard raises his white-tipped cok covered fingertips to Ron’s face. RICHARD (CONT’D) You are a man of numbers, right Ronny?  73. Ron doesn’t answer.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let me lay it out for you. I say you have two choices. Here, or there. Because I have a feeling that whatever shit you’re in, it is so deep it is going to fuck you in the ass and swallow you whole. Ron is sweating. He stops. He tries to breath.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (quiet) This is insane. (loud) This IS INSANE. (hand over mouth as the truth crashes into him) Oh my God, fucking Timmy. Ron's freaked eyes bounce of Richard's and Jonathan's.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: (gently) I think you should leave, Ron. I think it’s best.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Yeah, go home Ron. LEAVE. Ron takes a deep breath. Then another. Jonathan approache the table, leans over the saucer, snorts with a rolled up bill. He is so high it is difficult to make it work. Ron breathes in and out, in and out, then...

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I am packing up. And I am going home. Let’s just agree that I left before any of this happened. Richard and Jonathan nod. Ron looks at them, scared.

dialogues.speaker: RON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (don’t do this...) Promise you'll leave soon, okay? They just look at him. Ron suddenly grabs a chair from th table, lifts it, and smashes it back down on the ground a lets out a guttural animal scream. Then he marches down the hallway to his room...  92 93 94 74. Jonathan is tweaked. He looks up at Richard. Shivering. Dazed.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: We have to do something about Timmy.

dialogues.speaker: AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: Ron fumbles with keys to Tim’s rental car, tries to unloc the door. He sweats. He finally unlocks it, tosses his ba in the back, gets behind the wheel, backs out of the driveway, drives off. We follow FAST behind Ron, tail Ron, and then we are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see his eyes, his sweat, hands on wheel, rear view mir radio on LOUD, forehead and chest sweating, radio busines news playing, then SLAMMED OFF. Silence. Ron drives. He tries to breath. Rolls down a window. Grips the wheel. He looks like the most uncomfortable man in the world, until... He looks up. Sees the SMALL TOWN AIRPORT. THE WAY OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron waits with a few other TRAVELERS. He nervously looks his Blackberry. Sees 33 MISSED CALLS. Scans them. Most of them are from Amanda. He keeps scanning. Sees “MOM.” He stares at that name. “MOM.” Ron cracks. He cries, but it is inside, he holds it insid with the other pieces of his life he cannot look at in th light of day.  95 96 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music plays. Jonathan makes a drink in the kitchen. His left hand is wrapped with gauze and tape from the shatter shower door, we see blood soaking through. He walks us in the

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Where Richard stands, surrounded by the contents of Tim’s travel bags and wallet. Everything from boxer shorts to socks to toothbrush and comb to books to business cards. Laid out on the floor. It looks like ART. Jonathan looks at it all.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: This is all Tim's.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Good Richard. Very good. He looks at Tim’s belongings spread over the floor. He no Richard squats, picks up one of Tim’s shirts, holds it to face, and inhales. Then he looks at Jonathan, holds it ou as if to ask Jonathan if he wants to smell it as well. Jonathan simply stares at Richard.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I’m glad Ron left. His wife and his God will help him through whatever he’s gotten into.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan and Richard. Illuminated by the flickering flame of a single torch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand over a 9x4 foot mound of fresh dirt. They can hear the ocean but not the person walking silently up beh them.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: It feels more like a dream, or an apparition, when he tak his place next to them and stares into the flames. They do not acknowledge Ron, nor does he want them to. No of them want to acknowledge what it means.  7 We haltingly move toward them as they stare into the fire THE IMAGE SLOWS as their faces become part of the glowing fire, a hallucinatory melding of element and human form, painting of orange anguish, reflection and crazed light.

dialogues.speaker: THE VOICE
dialogues.text: When you are young, imagining forty or fifty years old is as abstract as science fiction. You are sitting there and you are twenty- one years old and you are invincible. It is all ahead of you. You are a horse with blinders, you only see ahead as you whip yourself into a frenzy of forward. At some point, something turns those blinders inward. A death here, a failed relationship there. You creep past thirty and patterns emerge, comforting and killing at the same time. Experience and wisdom get blown away by tragedy or the inexplicable. The hand of Fate taps on the shoulders of those around you and you pray and pray that you are immune. STILL SLOW MOTION: sand slides, water flows, eyes stare. THE VOICE (CONT’D) Your thirties fade. You’re the prime of definition as man, worker, careerist, actor in your own movie, creator, lover, in action how like an angel, in apprehension how like a God. You conquer and forge on, a string of victories that will never end and then you hit it but at first you don’t know what it is. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: THE VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It could be the death of a parent or the end of a marriage or the birth of a flawed child, and your forties arrive and you try to feel a sense of lightness and freedom, but it’s work, like the marriage and the job and the friendships and the kids and the health issues and nostalgia that suffocates you when the old song comes on, when the picture falls from the photo album, when the scent of something takes you back to when it wasn’t so hard, when all the self-help books in the world cannot possibly save you. And you hate it when you admit that someone else’s life is better than yours, even when yours is good. Jonathan, Richard and Ron slowly retreat. We move in towa the flames.

dialogues.speaker: THE VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is it good? You wouldn’t know because you are climbing, and as you climb you are scared, higher and wiser, happier but fatter, richer, lonelier, depraved, stubborn, loaded and still poorer or richer. Then you’1ll see the number 5-0 and the end is in view. You are formally officially absolutely admittedly closer to the end. You panic, dragged down by the feeling that you have not fulfilled the promise others predicted for you, the you promised and prayed for. You have no idea but know things will change, I promise. Just another promise broken. Lyrics to your song. All of them real. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan, Ron and Richard at a table. Unshaven. Pale. Paranoid. Black circles under their eyes.  78. Middle of lunch. None of it eaten, but they’re trying. Alcohol has replaced food, chemistry has replaced balance A beat later, Captain Bob walks past on his way out, surprises them.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BOB
dialogues.text: Hello. Three sets of eyes turn toward him - bleary, paranoid, nu

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (tries to be light) It’s Captain Bob.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: How are you?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BOB
dialogues.text: I’m fine. (then) Where’s your buddy Tim? They hesitate way too long.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: He...had something back in Portland.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: He had to take off. Captain Bob looks at them, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BOB
dialogues.text: He told me he was staying for four more days or something. Must have been disappointed to have to leave. Awkward beat. Captain Bob cuts through it. CAPTAIN BOB (CONT’D) Don’t tell me he went home sour ‘cause he didn’t catch any fish? This breaks the ice.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (slurred) That’s probably it.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: He was so embarrassed he ran home.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: He told us he had some important business. Captain Bob looks them over. His sharp eyes take in everything...

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BOB
dialogues.text: Well, take care boys. ..-and ambles out of there. The guys watch him leave, the look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the blue there’s a LOUD SCREAM and...

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Oh my God! Oh my God! Jonathan’s dulled attention sharpens as he turns and sees An OLD MAN (60-65) alone in a booth. The man is in troubl face going white, neck going slack, eyes closing. He fall to a knee on the ground.. JONATHAN VAULTS OUT OF HIS SEAT and runs to the man.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: (loud scream) Someone call emergency!! Seeing this guy with crazed bloodshot eyes and days of gr on his face screaming in this small town frightens people everyone’s so stunned they don’t answer. JONATHAN (CONT’D) (loud scream) Now! The old man collapses on the ground... Jonathan is wasted rising to the occasion. JONATHAN (CONT’D) Guys! MANAGER holding a phone screams from the cash register...

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: I got it, I got emergency! Jonathan looks at the man’s chest...it’s completely still Richard and Ron are right there now...  80.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Okay... Jonathan rips open the man’s shirt front, opens his mouth sticks his fingers in his throat to see if he’s choking. passage is all clear. He places two fingers on side of th old mans’ throat to feel his carotid. JONATHAN (CONT’D) Fuck... People hovering now... JONATHAN (CONT ’D) (to Richard / Ron) Get something to raise his legs up! Ron rips a cushion from a booth and slides it under the o man’s feet. JONATHAN (CONT’D) (screams to manager) How long till paramedics are here!?

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: On their way...

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: How fucking LONG! ? Beat. Beat. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Eight minutes...

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Okay...okay...shit. Jonathan tilts the old man’s head back, pinches his nostr gives him mouth to mouth. In. Out. In. Out. In. Out. The diner goes quiet. Everyone holds their breath. The OL MAN'S DAUGHTER stands in slow shock with her hands over h mouth so as not to scream. Jonathan breathes into the man’s body, stops, looks at th man’s chest... JONATHAN (CONT’D) Come on...live, live, live ...-leans down and tries again. Again and again and again  98 99 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aftermath of the drama. Hushed voices. Garbling chirp of ambulance radio OUTSIDE. The Old Man is on a gurney. The Old Man’s Daughter walks next to him as PARAMEDICS wheel him out. HE’S ALIVE. He looks up from his gurney and from behind his oxygen mask

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Who's standing next to Ron and Richard. As the paramedics slide him into the ambulance, the men form a circle near doorway. Richard looks around to make sure nobody is watching, indicates the coke he has in a folded piece of paper. Jonathan holds out the back of his hand and Richard dumps a bunch for him. At the very moment Jonathan snorts, the Old Man’s Daughte taps him on the shoulder, catching him in the act. He tur to her... OLD MAN’S DAUGHTER You saved my father’s life. Thank you. It is silent for a moment. Jonathan knows. She has gratitude, shock and repulsion doing battle in he brain. Jonathan wipes coke off his nose with the back of hand, says this like he just remembered it:

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I’m a doctor. She puts her hand on his shoulder, looks in his eyes. The she leaves. Ron stands unsteadily...

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: We should get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .»-Ron, Richard and Jonathan walk outside, turn away from crowd of people dispersing and flickering ambulance light

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Bob walking away from the scene, about half a blo away. He pauses when Laura Boyde rolls up in her squad ca  100 101 82.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BOB
dialogues.text: Larry McCaulay had a heart attack. Now they’re staring at the scene. Jonathan, Richard, and head away from the crowd, towards them.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: That’s a motley crew.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BOB
dialogues.text: (indicates Jonathan) One of them saved his life.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BOB
dialogues.text: I know them. They came out on the boat. Seems they’ve been hitting it pretty hard. She stares at them as they disappear around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: They from here? Captain Bob shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BOB
dialogues.text: Gotta take some folks out. He takes off. Boyde stays where she is. A beat later the Red Porsche buzzes out and heads up the street toward her. She sees the three guys inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police Chief Boyde pulls up in her patrol car, parks, get out, moves the intercom, presses the buzzer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyde pulls her squad car behind the red Porsche. Walks t door, knocks. Ron's face briefly appears in the window, then the door opens. Ron answers, acts casual, the confident business g stays behind the screen.  83.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry to bother you.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: No bother, what’s up?

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: The Athertons sometimes have me pass by, to check in. And I was in the area. Ron just waits.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s the four of you here?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: One guy left. Who’s counting?

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: Oh, nobody, it’s just that-

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Our other friend had to get back to Portland. For business. Boyde looks at Ron a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: Are you the doctor?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: No. The doctor is having a siesta. You know, after the heroics.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: (sincere) Yes. And it was heroic. She looks back at the cars in the driveway, the Porsche a the rental.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve seen that Porsche somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: My buddy bought it from a local. The other one is mine, the rental.  84.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: Oh, that’s yours? And what’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: My name’s Ron. Why? Something wrong? Boyde shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: No no. She waits. A long beat. Like she doesn’t know how to extract herself. Ron doesn’t want to shut the door on her. But he does. Slowly. Gently. Firmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyde walks to her vehicle, noting the license number on rental as she walks. 103 INT. POLICE STATION - BOYDE’S OFFICE - HALF HOUR LATE Boyde on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: Rented in San Francisco? She listens, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m going to need more than that. (beat) I want the name of the person who rented it. (she listens) It’s Laura Boyde, from the police department. She leans back in her chair, listens. OFFICER BOYDE (cont'd) Timothy Allen Arthurs. From Portland. She hangs up, troubled. Dials again. Waits.  104 85. BOYDE (cont'd) The name’s Timothy Allen Arthurs. All I have is Portland, no address. (beat) Thank you. Boyde writes the number down. Dials. Ringing, then:

dialogues.speaker: TIM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hi it’s Tim...leave a message.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: Mr. Arthurs, this is the Big Sur police department. It’s important that you make contact as soon as possible. The number here is 831- 626-3289.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard and Jonathan sit at the coffee table in front of fire. A glass framed map of Big Sur covered in chopped up pills on the table. Jonathan and Richard are as wasted as we've seen them. Jonathan’s head bows forward and his eyelids close.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Hey. Jonathan snaps awake. RICHARD (CONT’D) You're a mess, Jonathan. Jonathan looks at him, drunkenly begins mashing up pills against the map of Big Sur with a knife. Richard takes ha a teaspoon of cocaine from a baggy and dumps it on the pi

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You need it.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: A spoonful of sugar makes the medicine go down. Jonathan mixes the coke with the pills. JONATHAN (CONT’D) How long’s Ron been sleeping?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Hours.  86. Richard stands, unsteadily weaves through the living room IN RON’S ROOM Ron sits on the side of his bed. Awake. Staring at the floor. Richard walks in, pauses when he sees Ron. RICHARD (CONT’D) Hey. Ron doesn’t look up.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ronaldo...we have something...you gotta try it... Ron looks up. His face smeared with tears. RICHARD (CONT’D) What? Ron turns away. He is silent for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Fuck it. Richard stares at him. RON (CONT’D) I’m so scared, Richard.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: About the cop? Ron shakes his head “no.” RICHARD (CONT’D) Timmy? He shakes his head “no” again. Richard moves into the roo sits on the bed next to Ron. RICHARD (CONT’D) The money thing you’re involved in? Beat. Exhale.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: About what we're doing. Here. Richard swallows, gags a little on the post nasal drip of line he just did. He clears his throat. They are quiet a long time. Ron swallows bitterly.  87.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I’m scared too.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Amanda left me messages...they’re in my home, Richard. The feds are there. (looks at Richard) I’ve robbed clients, but I never cheated on Amanda. Never. (then, head down) At the beginning you’re helping people, enriching them. Then it gets inside you, some rationale, and you take some extra for yourself. One zero becomes two, and more and more. You get high and you drift. Richard looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: And you can’t recognize yourself. Ron covers his head. Richard moves to him. Beat. RICHARD (CONT’D) Why did you need so much?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I don’t know. (defensive) I love taking care of my family. I was the man, I really was the man for awhile. I wish you could have seen me, Richard.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Will she forgive you?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Nobody will.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I love you, Ron.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: You said you were scared...you don’t act like it.  88. RICHARD (CONT’D) I read something once that made me think about the note. ‘Cowardice masquerades as courage in motivating people to not do it.’ But I lie, and I hide. Ron turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Do it for me.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (strong) Fuck you, Ron.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I can’t do it.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Don’t.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I have to.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: You don’t. Just go home. Face it. Ron takes a deep breath. Exhales.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I want to...but...I have tried to see myself going home, and facing it, I’ve imagined her seeing me, looking into me, my eyes. I can’t face that. (beat) We are destitute. They sit there. It’s a long moment. The longest we can handle. Richard doesn’t look at Ron when he says.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Lie down. On the bed. Ron does. Puts his hands at his sides. Richard stands, looks down at Ron.  89.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you sure? Ron nods. Tears rolling.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Remember how we met? Richard crawls on the bed, straddles Ron.

dialogues.speaker: RON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought you were the biggest asshole. But cool. Richard looks at him. Ron speaks gently.

dialogues.speaker: RON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I felt sorry for you. This dark guy with a dead dad. Richard picks up a pillow from beside Ron's head.

dialogues.speaker: RON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were the most interesting guy in the dorm. You turned me on to Holiday In Cambodia. Remember? Richard holds the pillow to his own chest. He nods. Tears well in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: RON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I turned you on to The Pretenders.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Stop now.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: You remember that? Richard nods.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Stop talking now.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (speaks it softly) You arrived like a day, and passed like a cloud, I made a wish, I said it out loud, out loud in a crowd, everybody heard, “twas the talk of the town.” (beat) You loved that song.  105 106 90. Their eyes are locked. He slowly brings the pillow down o Ron’s face. Richard applies pressure. Ron’s hands stay li at his sides. We hear a muffled groan from beneath the pillow and Ron's hands raise, try to fight off Richard. His fingernails di into Richards forearms and draw blood. Richard uses every ounce of strength he has. Finally, Ron’s body goes limp. Richard looks down at Ron’ hands as they fall away from his forearms. He slowly crawls off Ron, leaves the pillow over his face Richard sits on the bed next to Ron. Then he rests his head on Ron’s chest. He stays there a moment. His voice is a soft cracked whis when he tries to sing more of the Pretenders song, “it’s my place, to know what you feel, I’d like to know, but wh should I?” Richard stands, walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan looks up with glazed eyes at Richard.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: He awake? Richard slowly shakes his head “no.” Jonathan and Richard stare at each other for a long beat. Jonathan’s eyes find the fingernail cuts on Richard’s forearms. Jonathan seems to sense what has happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan and Richard stand by a mound of dirt next to Tim grave. Richard lights a torch with a match and a huge bal of fire forces them back. The camera slowly pushes through the fire and Richard put his arm around Jonathan, leans in close and whispers in t flickering orange light.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: He has better things in store, beyond anything you could think or ask. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The dying is a sheer kindness to the black soul. Not a light. But a step by shallow step, welcome our menace and shadow. Listen to me, the beginning of the end is quiet and velvet. This is the perfect failure. And the two friends lean on each other, knowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three-hundred feet above the sea. We see Boyde emerge fro small sheriff's office. She takes in the view as walks toward a picnic table. A FEW MINUTES LATER... Boyde sits with her sister, KATIE. Nearby, Katie’s two BO STEVIE (7) and MATT (4) play on the grass.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: It’s funny isn’t it? How you can’t predict what anyone is going to end up like.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Well, you can, kind of, I mean, Stevie’s like his dad, mechanical. And Matt’s just creative as anything.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: I know he is. I still have the drawing of the rabbit he did up in my office. He’s a bit of a charmer too. They look at Matt. He’s lost in the sensation of running blade of grass over his nose.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m glad I never had children. Katie turns to her, tries to guess what she means by this

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: You're afraid you'd be a bad mother.  92.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: No, no. All the worry, all the fear you must have. Everything is so random.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: It’s a trade off. (then) You don’t get love without fear.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: (nodding) True. A beat while they watch the boys.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where are the men, Katie? Katie’s eyes widen, this is not the kind of question she’ used to from her sister.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Well if Jeff's any measure, I scare mine away. If that’s what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: You didn’t scare him away. All three of you did. The family.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know if I ever expected more, maybe that’s the problem.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: I didn’t mean that anyway. I meant why do they run, and shut us out. (then) And then say we’re skittish. Katie turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (gently) Don’t look at me like that. I don’t hate men, I love them. (then) It’s just that they expect you to be there and then they dissolve right in front of you.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: They disappear.  108 109 93. Matt turns toward Boyde, stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: You'd think there would be a lot more people in love than there are. Matt makes his way to her, a sweet smile on his face. He holds out his hand, says one simple word.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Play. And takes her hand. She stands, smiles back at Katie as M pulls her out on the grass.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: Told you he was a charmer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blows past us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Local bar. Loaded with locals. Juke Box plays. Jonathan and Richard watch TWO LOCAL GUYS (30'S) play pool. They wait to play the winner. Richard holds a large glass beer. It slips from his fingers and explodes on the floor Player #1 looks up from his shot.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYER
dialogues.text: Can’t handle your beer, huh faggot? Player #1 goes back to his shot, buries it. Richard sees six inch wide cigarette-burned wood shelf running the len of the wall beneath the sign-up chalkboard. There are two beers on it. Richard casually walks over and drains one.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYER
dialogues.text: Hey. Hey! Then he drains the other one.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYER
dialogues.text: Those were our beers, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: You made unnecessary commentary regarding my misfortune as well as a gay slur. So I drank your beers. We're even.  94.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYER
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: How could that possibly matter?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: (warning) Richard...

dialogues.speaker: PLAYER
dialogues.text: You’re gonna buy us two beers. Or buy yourself a taxi to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I’m not buying you anything, and my friend here is a physician so I can get treatment right here if I require it.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYER
dialogues.text: You just barked up the wrong tree asshole because I’m your worst fucking nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: You need new material my friend. “Worst fucking nightmare?” “Barked up the wrong tree?” You’re joking, right? Here, I’1l give you one: I fucked your girlfriend so hard in the ass she cried. (beat) For more. (beat) Oh, wait, that’s been used before too, by all the guys who fucked your cock sucking whore girlfriend in the ass. The local rushes round the table toward Richard. Richard stands, slowly closes his eyes...waits for the pain...wanting it...the local clenches his fists, winds up...deep in Richard’s mind we hear him whisper...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Punish me for what I have done... BOOM...time stops.  112 113 95. Jonathan watches Richard’s head slam against the floor... it bounce...the crowd gathers...another fight in a bar wi history...on the surface no different from the rest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard is passed out on the couch. There’s a knock on fr door. It becomes harder and louder. Richard’s eyes blink open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard stands at the sink, quickly splashes water over h face. Runs his fingers through his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard walks to the door with sunglasses on, opens it en to see who it is. Police Chief Boyde. Richard conjures sobriety.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Yes. Boyde looks at him through the screen.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: May I have a word with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard and Boyde stand on the porch.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: I heard about the fight last night.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I don’t know if you can call ita fight.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: You okay? Bartender said you were hit pretty hard.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I deserved it.  This surprises her a little. She sees where some still caked around his nostrils.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: Not sure if I totally believe it. The guy at the bar, it’s not the first time he’s been in a bar fight.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: You don’t say.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: Just do me a favor and stay clear of that place. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: I’m not raising much of a stink because your friend saved Eddie Iverson’s life. He’s a doctor, right? 96. blood is Richard nods. Ron’s cell phone rings again and again insi the house. BOYDE(CONT’D) You wanna get that?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: It’s okay. Boyde asks this casually.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: I have a problem I’m trying to solve. Your friend Ron told me the rental in the driveway was his. I checked it out and it belongs to Tim Arthurs. Richard tries to gloss it over.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s Tim’s rental. We’re returning it for him. I don’t know why Ron would say that.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: May I speak to him?  97. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: Ron.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: He had to go see an old friend. Left early this morning.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: How'd he leave?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: A taxi? I don’t know, I was sleeping. Boyde stares at Richard for a long uncomfortable time.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: Mind if I looked around? Richard’s demeanor shifts from casual to worried but his sunglasses hide it.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Not a lot to do around here, huh? Tight smile from Boyde. Ron’s phone stops ringing in the house. She walks around the side of the house to the back. Richard follows closely behind her and sees Jonathan befo Boyde does. Jonathan is hurriedly cleaning the area over Tim and Ron' graves. Richard needs to distract her, fast.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey excuse me? She turns back to Richard, just what he wanted her to do. RICHARD (CONT’D) The old guy from the diner, how's he holding up?  114 98.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: His daughter Emily said he’s doing fine. Beyond her, Richard sees Jonathan silently slip inside th house. Richard relaxes.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I’m glad to hear he’s hanging in there. She stares at him, then turns and continues toward the-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to see what remnants are visible in the ashes. Jonathan has done a good job - to the naked eye, it doesn look like anything at all. The sliding glass door opens. Jonathan calls out from the

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: (casual) Everything okay? She turns, looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: I had a question about your cars. Now she turns to Richard. They are close. We see her inhale. She smells the booze on him. She looks into his eyes a be Some uneasy feeling washes over her.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Why are you here? Stops her cold. RICHARD (CONT’D) (to Jonathan, answering for her) She has a question about the cars. (to Boyde) Right? Right? Boyde looks at Richard, conscious of her own sudden discomfort, but she holds her ground.  99.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: Can I see your eyes? Richard hesitates, then slowly takes them off. Their eyes meet. His are bloodshot.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (sincere) You're very pretty, that’s for damn sure. They are inches away from each other.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: Scotch, right? Richard eases off.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: (to Boyde, alleviating) We're leaving tomorrow. She looks at Jonathan. Then Richard. The phone begins ringing again in the house. Boyde and Jonathan and Richard stand there, listening to none of them moving. Then Richard turns and follows Jonat into the house. Boyde turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan sits at the kitchen table taking inventory of th drugs.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: We’re running out. He begins chopping up an odd pink pill.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Agenerase. An HIV-1 drug. It’s Timmy’s. Thought it would be a nice gesture. Richard sprays nasal decongestant into his nostrils.  120 121 100.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Yes. Ron’s Blackberry rings on the mantle again. Richard picks it up, sees the caller I.D. Picture - it’s Amanda, smiling. Richard looks at Jonathan, shows him the screen. Then he tosses Ron’s Blackberry onto the fire in the fireplace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A red dot on the horizon. Growing in size. Blasting by us with a blur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan and Richard. Red bloodshot eyes stare straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Porsche, parked. Unnatural light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frantic. Jonathan tears three prescriptions off a pad and passes them to Richard. Jonathan’s hands are shaking.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: If they ask, say you’ve had a knee operation. But they won’t ask. Richard takes the prescription, gets out of the car, clos the door. Jonathan sits back, closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard walking. Bending into the hellish florescent ligh a spectre at the end of an aisle melting into the garish displays on either side of him, seeing the Pharmacy sign the back of the store come in and out of focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard whips open the door of the Porsche, gets inside, holding a Walgreens bag.  122
Jonathan wakes up - he had dozed off. Richard reaches in bag and removes a DUCK key chain. Hands it to Jonathan.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: My gift to you. Press the button. Jonathan does. A sharp “quack” issues from the chip insid the duck. He smiles and looks closely at the duck.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: A comment on my career path?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: He’s quick ladies and gentlemen. Richard hands Jonathan the prescription bag. Jonathan feels the weight of it, looks inside, pulls out fistful of refrigerator magnets with life affirmation quo “he who limps is still walking” and “do not let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do” and “Your attit determines your altitude.” He looks at Richard, then sticks the magnets to the dash the Porsche. They sit in silence a moment looking at them A moment passes, then Richard looks at Jonathan. RICHARD (CONT’D) We should go.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: You're behind the wheel. Richard, realizing he is.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Oh. Right. (beat) I'd like to see some trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Porsche whistles past like a blazing red bullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Racing past us and disappearing around a corner...  123 124 125
123 Jonathan in passenger seat, prescription bottles on his l Jonathan looks at a prescription bottle, reads: Oxycontin

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Oxycontin slows brain activity, and cuts off pain signals. Like intercepting a bill you don’t want to pay before it arrives at your house. You can see why people get addicted. One in six doctors are addicted to painkillers.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Pain. Killers. Richard stares out the window, teetering at the edge of reality. RICHARD (CONT’D) I remembered but Timmy fucking did it. He didn’t forget. He never forgot. (beat) I wanted to be the first, he stole my thunder. I wanted to be the reason. Richard trails off, then unleashes a mad SCREAM. Then he leans back, drives as he closes his eyes. slowly and calmly. RICHARD (CONT’D) There’s always the sun. Jonathan watches his friend drive blindly. RICHARD’S POV - THRU WINDSHIELD - BIXBY BRIDGE Speaks 124 Eyes wide now. The Porsche approaches the towering majest bridge.

dialogues.speaker: THE PORSCHE
dialogues.text: 125 Winding up toward the redwoods. The SOUND DROPS OUT and w hear footsteps, which takes us to...  126 127 128 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard and Jonathan walk, dwarfed by these ancient and majestic trees. They move in and out of shadows and light Jonathan drops pill after pill from a prescription bottle leaving a trail behind him. He feels Richard’s eyes on him, stops.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: So we can find our way back. Jonathan's eyes register the scratch marks Ron left on Richard’s forearms. Jonathan turns and keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Nobody wants us, Hansel. Their footsteps over the bark and twigs is all we hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard leans against a tree. He’s spinning the butter kn he used to do coke with Tim in his hand. Jonathan sits on the forest floor. He looks in Richard's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: (re: the scratches on Richard’s forearms) He fought, didn’t he? Richard raises his eyes to Jonathan. A wave of feeling washes over him. An acknowledgement. An imperceptible nod JONATHAN (CONT’D) The body fights. In opposition to what the mind wants. Richard feels the tree against his back. He turns to it. stares into the bark of it. He looks at the knife in his hands, turns toward the tree...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard stands at the tree, with Jonathan behind him. We move CLOSER and see Richard carving the letter “T” int the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan finishes carving the letter “J” into the tree tr They've carved a T, R, R & J into it. They look at each other. There’s a long silent beat. Richard raises his hand, rests it on Jonathan’s chest.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I feel like running. Richard stares at him. It’s possible that Richard doesn’t know what Jonathan means, but then... JONATHAN (CONT’D) Run with me, Richard. (then) Can you run with me? Jonathan turns and jogs away. Richard stares after him. Richard’s eyes brighten and become child-like as he watch Jonathan running through the trees. He takes off after him. We don’t follow. We stay back until they become small...until they almost like little boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard and Jonathan are near a cliff overlooking the oce Jonathan sits on the ground, looking up at Richard, who stands closer to the cliff. Richard turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: ..+.-you remember in college, when Ron and Tim and you and I went to that concert flying on X? When I was cleaning out all my Mom’s stuff last year, I found the ticket stub in an old box -- it was Modern English, The Cure and XTC and some other bands. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) We were so HIGH! Remember?! We couldn't even like fucking speak. And Modern English was singing that song (sings) ...-dropped in the state of imaginary grace...

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: (softly singing the background vocal of the song) You should know better.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (resuming) I remember I felt these strange rays of light...and it was coming from you guys, from your eyes, and I was so fucking happy. And it wasn’t this forced happiness...it was honest, and calm...fuck man it was so pure, all these dreams that felt real, like they could happen. (can’t find the words) I lived on that image for days, it was like it was burned into my brain, like I was still high from the drug, and you guys, but it wasn’t the drugs, it was us, and I never forgot it... (long beat) I’ve never been that happy since. I’ve never even been close. Richard trails off. He turns away toward the sea. The win rises against them. Jonathan watches as Richard walks closer to the edge of t cliff. He stares at Richard’s back. Looks down at how clo Richard’s feet are to the edge of the cliff. Jonathan silently stands up. Beat. Jonathan EXPLODES toward Richard, lays a fierce tackle on at chest-height. They fly over the cliff. And disappear. We hear ocean pounding the rocks below.  130 106. We creep toward the edge and by degrees the sky fades int deeper color of blue and we are suddenly in mid-flight wi

dialogues.speaker: ANIMATED RICHARD AND JONATHAN 130
dialogues.text: In a CARTOON LANDSCAPE. They drop fast, feet first, towar jagged rocks below, paralysed with cartoon fear, the spee their death fall accompanied by a DOPPLERING TRAIN WHISTL But then Jonathan holds out the hem of his shirt, which h the wind-catching effect of a parachute.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Hey Richard! Look! Richard does it as well.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN / RICHARD
dialogues.text: We can fly!!! They drift down softly, dreamily, blissed out looks on th cartoon faces. Their voices are upbeat, cheery.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: This is so awesome!

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Hey Rich, maybe things will turn out okay after all!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Know what Jonno? I’m gonna join a health club and clean out my body, hang out at Starbucks and rejoin society! And as they float...

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I’m going come to terms with the fact that my wife shattered my heart and that I barely have a relationship with my son. Then I’m going to meet a nice girl, straighten out my medical practice and join a church!  107.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: You can do it Jon! You just can! And I’m gonna sit down and write that second novel I always said I'd write!

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Great! A best-seller!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Hey, it’s never too late for redemption! (beat) Maybe that’s what I’1l write about! Heck Jonno, maybe that will be the title!

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: “Never too late for redemption?!” I love it! Richard and Jonathan float gently toward an animated flat rock on the shore. Richard looks down.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Look, we're going to land nice and soft!

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: This is so incredible!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: The happy ending we all wish for is going to come true! Distant high pitched whistling. Approaching fast...

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Everybody loves a happy ending!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Especially after a massage! Jonathan and Richard gently touch down on the rock, huge smiles pasted on their faces... RICHARD (CONT’D) To new beginnings!

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Things are going to get better after all! They raise their hands in preparation for a “high five.”  131 132 133 134 135 108.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Let’s live out our very own fairy tales! They slap five. Whistling grows LOUDER. Something from the sky. Jonathan and Richard look up. Their happy animated smiles transform to stunned dread.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD / JONATHAN
dialogues.text: (unison) Oh shit. A huge flat rock like that of a Roadrunner cartoon falls blazing speed, SQUASHES them with a HUGE BLOODY CARTOON

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO REALITY 131
dialogues.text: Jonathan leans over the cliff, wasted grin on his face. Richard turns toward him.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Let’s go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night is falling in the sky behind the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is silent. INT. HOUSE - JONATHAN’S ROOM - DUSK 134 Jonathan, shirt soaked in sweat, shaking a little, tries muster sobriety as he dials his cell.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Jane?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Hi Jonathan. I’11 get Miles.  109.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Thanks Jane. Miles comes to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: How are you, buddy?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: How is everything?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: That’s good.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (suddenly excited) Daddy took me in a helicopter yesterday, because he had to meet someone for lunch. Jonathan. Crushed on the word “Daddy.” MILES (CONT’D) I was a only a little scared.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Miles. I’m your Daddy. Daniel is your stepfather.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: We could see the whole city.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Do you know that? Jonathan’s eyes are welling up but he fights it back.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Daniel is your step-father, Miles. I’m your father. Jane crosses through the room in the b.g., slips into a c  136 137 110.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Say goodbye Miles. We have to go.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Promise me you won’t forget that. Okay Miles? Please.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I have to go. Mom said.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: (as Miles hangs up) Okay Miles. I love you. Jonathan slumps on the edge of the bed, cell phone in his hands. He sets his cell phone on the dresser next to his stethoscope. JONATHAN (CONT’D) I love you son. He picks it up, places the earpiece into his ear canals, presses the chest-piece against his heart. There is nothing but silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan lies on the bed, belt wrapped tightly around his upper arm and a needle stuck in his arm. His eyes are just closing as we go to...

dialogues.speaker: THE CEILING 137
dialogues.text: Slowly transforming into a projection screen for the home movie playing in his chemically altered mind. It’s a movie with Jonathan and Miles, two years earlier, beach at water’s edge in the sun. Images are dream-like. They play a game of TAG. Jonathan deftly but barely escaping Miles’ touch. They are both laughing hysterically until he slips, and Miles is sudden upon him. Miles voice sounds distant, he says the same thing over a over and the sound of it fills Jonathan with joy.  138 139 111. Instead of “I love you more than anything in the whole wi world,” Miles has his three year old’s shorthand:

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I love you in the whole wide world...I love you in the whole wide world...I love you in the whole wide world. Miles and Jonathan roll in the sand at water’s edge, over by pure joy as a wave slaps the shore and washes over the And then the screen in Jonathan’s mind bleeds to BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard stands at the end of the hallway, staring. He walks toward us like he is trying to be utterly silent When he passes us we go to- RICHARD’S POV Walking down the hall and into INT. JONATHAN’S ROOM - DOORWAY - CONTINUOUS 139 Richard stares through bloodshot eyes at Jonathan. Jonathan is ghostly white with a syringe stuck in his arm He’s half on the bed and half off. He is not breathing. Richard turns away, rests his forehead against the door frame.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I came to tell you I cannot do this. He stays there a long moment. He walks to Jonathan, gentl lifts his feet off the floor and up onto the bed. He removes the syringe and belt from his arm.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There you go buddy. He looks at his friend and walks out of the room.  140 141 112. The SOUND OF A DIGGING SHOVEL brings us to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard fills in a hole next to Tim and Ron’s graves. Sweating and breathing hard. This is the everything. The dream we see and deny, the darkness coming to all of us t lives within us, the day we all pretend will never come. Richard is the ultimate loneliness.

dialogues.speaker: THE VOICE
dialogues.text: ...each day demands we create our whole world over, disguising the constant horror in a coat of many- colored fictions; we mask our past in the green of Eden, pretend future's shining fruit can sprout from the navel of this present waste. In faith we shall board our imagined ship, and sail among sacred islands of the mad, till death shatters the fabulous stars and makes us real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deafening music. Richard chews a variety of pills like candy, washing them down with beer. Richard is painting. His movements are unnaturally jerky. What started as a co of the little kid Bobby’s painting, which has been ripped from its frame and taped to the wall, has grown into a hu twisted allegorical mural across the windows of the livin room. It is of himself, of his life and his end...four mounds o dirt, the end image of a man jumping over the cliff. The caption of the mural is best friends forever and ther are other smaller texts weaved into the mural: “stick to word” and “a deal’s a deal” “Ian + Sylvia" and “the last autonomous act” and “criminal & victim are the same” and this is cowardice what is courage?”

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We are lost and we are liars, we fill the hole. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Lick it, suck it, smoke it, snort it, fuck it, eat it, kill it, push it down and it’s still there. We are the stroke, the follow through. This is it. This is the everything, the beginning middle and end. Richard is deranged, he has entered a different zone of thought and space and time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyde speaks with another OFFICER, (STEVENS, 50, MALE).

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: Well, I want to get in there, but I‘1l need a warrant.

dialogues.speaker: STEVENS
dialogues.text: Is it drugs?

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: Yes. And it’d gotten out of control. It’s not recreational now. Boyde thinks.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What if I went to Judge Bendis and said they’re dealing.

dialogues.speaker: STEVENS
dialogues.text: (raises eyebrows, good idea) That’11 work. Stevens nods. The phone rings. Boyde picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Police department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. TIM’S LOFT/APARTMENT - KITCHEN - PORTLAND - EARLY 14

dialogues.speaker: MORNING
dialogues.text: The Woman, Lisa, we saw at the beginning stands in Tim’s apartment, a cell phone pressed to her ear. She has opene the envelope that Tim left called “Lisa 2” and she’s hold a note. Lisa is in total shock.  144 145 146 114.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (voice quivering) I need to speak to the Police. About Tim Arthurs. Something he wrote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura Boyde listens. By degrees we see her expression digest and go dark as sh tries to comprehend what this Lisa is telling her. Stevens watches. Boyde hangs up and bolts out of the offi

dialogues.speaker: STEVENS
dialogues.text: What? EXT. HIGHWAY ONE - BOYDE’S VEHICLE 145 Races past...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard’s bloodstream coursing with a volatile mixture of chemicals and alcohol. He is talking quietly to himself o the living room floor as he stares at his mural while listening to “Kyoko’s House” By Philip Glass full blast. He holds his knees close to his chest and rocks. His rock appears to be a way to not become ill, or stay on some li of thought in his mind, or hold back some terrible pain b born inside of him. The little boy’s painting is on the floor by his feet, as Richard’s shoes and a bottle of wine. He looks between th painting and the mural. Hard banging on the door. He turns toward it. He tries to say something but nothing comes out. The door opens. He turns, sees Boyde there. She walks in. She stops cold at the site of the mural.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Do you like it? It is like she cannot take her eyes off it. Or speak. She scans the room. Sees the drugs.  115.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re: drugs) Have some. With the music blasting, and mural, she can FEEL the atmosphere in here, the darkness and vanished presences.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: I need to know where your friends are. Richard starts putting on one of his shoes. Boyde moves t stereo, turns off the music. Pure silence for a beat. The silence has it’s own hellish feel. Boyde stares at Richar

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Are you here to save me? Richard takes a large slug from the wine bottle. Holds it for Boyde. She shakes her head. Richard puts the bottle down, looks at the little boy’s painting, picks it up, holds it up to her. RICHARD (CONT’D) Can this keep me alive all by itself? Can you? You have love inside of you. I could've... (beat) I could’ve...never...never... Boyd is shocked by his state. Richard gathers himself...a little. RICHARD (CONT’D) But my friends...I loved them. But after awhile, do you even know them? When you get sucked down into your lives, you don’t. Richard stops and the world blurs. RICHARD (CONT’D) Do you feel time racing? I feel it. You’re a woman, I know you do. How would we really know if it was moving faster? Would you ? Richard closes his eyes. RICHARD (CONT’D) I’m closer...  116. He moves towards her, Richard looks at the ragged piece o paper, with his friends writing, staring at him. On the table, picks it up. RICHARD (CONT’D) (then) I loved them. I thought about them when I was weak but it only made me feel weaker because... She looks at his red eyes, bloody. RICHARD (CONT’D) ...because you can’t have the past back. No nono... and they reminded me of the past. So I rejected them...every time we were together none of us were present. Wasted. Always wasted. Richard drinks from the wine bottle. RICHARD (CONT’D) We didn’t do what we said we'd do. He tosses the bottle aside. RICHARD (CONT’D) Maybe all this... (what has happened here) ...was our way of saying we remembered what we used to feel. (beat) That means something, doesn’t it? He starts putting on his other shoe. RICHARD (CONT’D) You wanna know where my friends are? They’re dead. They’re in the back. Buried beneath the sand. When the words hit Boyde it’s like something in her defle them, or pushes them away. The unspeakable truth. She looks at him. RICHARD (CONT’D) I’m surprised you didn’t notice before. What kind of cop are you anyway? I mean you walked out there. Remember?  147 148 149 117. Boyde’s face changes...by degrees her expression grows darker... RICHARD (CONT’D) Here’s one: Jimmy Swaggart calls up Billy Graham and says, “Billy, can prostitutes be saved?” And Billy says, with religious fire in his voice, “Jimmy...every single one of us can be saved.” And Jimmy says to Billy, “good, then save me one for Saturday night.” Richard laughs to himself. Boyde looks between Richard an the back door. RICHARD (CONT’D) I’m going to make you now a light for the whole world. I swear to you that I am not lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyde steps outside. Smoldering embers on Jonathan's grav She walks toward it, tentatively. She sees charred remnants of wallets, credit cards and clothes, cash, toothbrushes, shoes over the outline of th man-sized graves. BOYDE’S FACE Undergoes lethal transformation. Disbelief. Fear. Nausea. Realization. She buckles, puts her hands on her knees, there is not en air...she rises and Boyde suddenly HEARS a MOTOR REVVING---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Boyde bursts inside, bolts through the empty living room the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyde sees the Porsche tearing out of driveway, runs and jumps into her squad car, races after Richard's car...  150 151 152 153 154 155 156 157 158 118.
Tail lights of the Porsche BLOW BY, HEADING TOWARDS THE OCEAN, the road looming in the distance. INT. BOYDE’S SQUAD CAR - MOVING 151 She guns her engine to keep up. Her eyes are shocked and moist...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyde’s squad car BLOWS BY races after Richard's Porsche. INT. RICHARD’S PORSCHE - MOVING FAST 153 Richard, dead stare, wine bottle stuck between his knees. Over his shoulder we see him approaching the hill, the sa rising epic view of his painting, the end of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Porsche enters the awe inspiring vista, the road lead to the top of the lighthouse. INT. SQUAD CAR - BOYDE’S FACE 155 Boyde sees where he is heading, the highest point of the coast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard is looking out the dangerous cliff side, right outside his window, he yells in a gutteral release

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see how close to the edge and dangerously high we are going. INT. SQUAD CAR - BOYDE’S POV 158 The Porsche disappears around the winding road, up the hi  159 160 161 162 163 119.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard sees something up ahead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Racing. One behind the other. Up the hill, to the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard’s eyes are wide and burning. Intense. Focused. Scared. The nose of the car climbs toward the top of the horizon line. Beyond that all there is, only the sky. Richard skids to a stop. At the edge of the cliff. We see it as he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face ashen, as she approaches and sees Richard's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyde’s heart is racing. She gets out. Walks towards the still idling Porsche, ominously perched near the edge, a small thin fence it’s only defense to a 300 foot plunge. Boyde knows this place very well. It’s her place, her domain. Her ability to see everything from this vantage point is now turning back to her. She walks to the car door, slightly ajar and peers inside darkened window- She slowly opens it. It is empty. And looks down, on the seat, she’s a piece of small tatte piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: THE NOTE
dialogues.text: She reads it, the words sinking her, clarity overwhelming her, the world turning upside down.  164 120. The end of the pact, the final friend.

dialogues.speaker: BOYDE
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyde runs, up the hill, past the steep descending wooden stairs and looks in the distance as

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD-
dialogues.text: Walks towards the edge of the bluff, the sea and world beneath him, endless and infinite. Richard looks over at Boyde. Her worst fears being seen, realized. They stare at each other. Richard takes a large pull off the wine bottle. THROWS IT

dialogues.speaker: OFF INTO THE SEA
dialogues.text: Richard looks out at the sky, the ocean. Up at the world. Looking down at him. Then he looks at her. She sees him. Witnesses it. Walks slowly towards him, pal unfurling. Richard stares at her. His eyes are welling up. He fights this urge. HE MOVES CLOSER, THE WORLD AND WIND, SWIRLING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His feet are inches from the edge. She slowly comes even closer. No words, only this gesture, the simplest one man has eve known. It is subtle, small, instinctive. She slowly begins to op her arms towards him. And he sees this and turns away, looking out to the sea.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: It’s...so...fucking...beautiful. Boyde does not take her eyes off Richard. Richard looks b from the cliff.  121. And into her eyes. RICHARD (CONT’D) (softly) And I am so goddamm scared. But in this fire in his eyes, she knows. She slowly shakes her head, it doesn’t have to come to th

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER BOYDE
dialogues.text: No, Richard. He smiles a beautiful smile at her.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I'd miss my friends too much. (beat) And a deal’s a deal. He looks over at Boyde. He closes his eyes, and breathes. Inside where he knows the view, the end. RICHARD (CONT’D) So I don’t...so I don’t have to see. Richard opens his eyes. Wide. He moves to jump-

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER BOYDE
dialogues.text: Don't! Boyde suddenly rushes towards him...their eyes lock...one split second. The world stops. Richard leaps off of the cliff. And sails into the sky... And drops out of sight... She stares toward the cliff. Silence. Except for the sound of waves crashing below. She hesitates, then walks to the edge. She stops. She doesn’t look down. She just stares straight out to the sea.  165 122. Then, slowly, she turns her eyes toward the approaching n sky, feeling that she is the only person left at the end the world. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: We are at the beginning, in 1984, moving behind the silhouette of the four guys, around the back to the beginning. Richard, Ron, Jonathan and Richard come into focus, laugh in their graduation gowns amid the celebration. They look into one another’s smiling eyes. They throw their arms around each other in a joyous group embrace, inadvertently lose their balance and tumble over folding chairs to the ground, laughing, stumbling, fallin all the way to the end.
